span.em: Having technical difficulties? Give us a call.

p.span: This hotline is open M-F 8:30 am and 4 pm.
If you still need a Chromebook or help getting internet access, please contact your teacher.

$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

p.span: Updates will be sent to parents via email and text message. Urgent or timely updates will also be communicated via "robo call." If you are not getting District emails, texts or "robo calls," you may need to update your communication preferences. Learn more here.
We will also be posting all information shared with families on this web page, and on the District Facebook page.
Anyone can sign-up to receive our School Closure Updates below.

p.span: Y-Kids is providing childcare at West Hills STEM Academy and Armin Jahr Elementary. If you have questions about Y-Kids, please contact:Kitsapchildcare@ymcapkc.orgor360-813-1813.

li.span: City of Bremerton COVID Information & Community Resources
Kitsap Community Foundation COVID response page

Stand-Up for Kids: Stand-Up for Kids will have representatives at BHS during meal distribution on Mondays and Wednesdays withsoap/shampoo, deodorant, toothbrush/paste for teens in need. Contact Jennifer.Chamberlin@BremertonSchools.org with requests for Femininehygieneproductsandformula and diapers.
Multicare offering free "E-Visits" for anyone who has COVID-19 symptoms
Need to talk to a healthcare provider? ContactPeninsula Community Health Services at 360-377-3776 orsbhc@pchsweb.org. PCHS also has a chat feature on their website.

p.span: DOH Hotline: The Washington State Department of Health has established a call center to address questions from the public. If you have questions about what is happening in Washington, how the virus is spread, and what to do if you have symptoms, please call 1-800-525-0127 and press #.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.strong: rom: Seattle Chapter Japanese Americans Citizens League (JACL)

p.span: The onset of the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States has coincided with a dramatic rise in racist anti-Asian hate incidents.The incidents have occurred across the country and have ranged from outright violent attacks to various forms of verbal harassment and discriminatory exclusion.Anecdotal information shows that incidents have occurred throughout the Puget Sound area as well, including in Bellevue, Issaquah, Renton, Seattle, and Tacoma.

Police and governmental officials inSeattle, Bellevue,and other localities encourage individuals experiencing or witnessing incidents to report all hate crimes, including verbal harassment, so that an accurate picture of anti-Asian hate activity can be created.Call 911 right away in order to report an immediate threat or an ongoing incident. Incidents that occurred in the recent past can be reported online or by phone.
In addition to reporting incidents to law enforcement, the JACL has gathered a list of resources for families to access for support:

li.span: Reporting verbal harassment, discrimination, or hate crimes, call Seattle Office for Civil Rights at (206) 223-7100 orfile a complaint online.

Also submit a report online to theCoronavirus Anti-AAPI Racism Incident Reportto help build a national response. Responses can be anonymous, and reports can be made in English or in 11 different Asian languages.

p.span: JACL requests that school districts post these resources in a prominent and accessible location on their websites for families, staff and students to refer to if needed.
Questions can also be directed to the Seattle Chapter JACL:info@seattlejacl.org
--Sent on behalf of Seattle Chapter Japanese American Citizens League by Dr. Kyle Kinoshita, JACL Board Member
